title: India-US trade deal: 'We don't make deals based on deadlines,' says Piyush Goyal
content: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal stated that any trade agreement between India and the United States will only occur if it benefits both nations. India does not adhere to deadlines for trade agreements.

title: Pune rape case: 'Delivery agent' who assaulted techie in flat arrested
content: Pune police detained a man accused of raping a 22-year-old IT professional in Kondhwa. The suspect posed as a courier executive. He allegedly raped her after gaining entry to her flat. He also clicked a selfie with her unconscious. The man threatened to release her photos if she reported the crime. Police are investigating the case and reviewing CCTV footage.

title: Marathi slapgate row: Fadnavis says 'hooliganism will not be tolerated'
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has vowed zero tolerance for hooliganism in the name of Marathi pride, following recent assaults on individuals for not speaking the language. This statement comes after incidents like the Mira Road assault, where a shop owner was attacked.

title: Scary scene! Shubman Gill takes nasty blow to the head
content: During the second Test against England, Indian captain Shubman Gill was struck on the head while fielding, causing immediate concern. Fortunately, after treatment, he resumed playing. This incident followed Gill's emotional high after receiving messages from his parents, celebrating his record-breaking double century, marking a significant milestone in his career and India's Test history in England.

title: Tesla CEO reiterates push to deorbit ISS: Shares post on Twitter; says ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs time to retire‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: Elon Musk has once again advocated for the deorbiting of the International Space Station (ISS), suggesting a shift in focus towards Mars missions. Citing the ISS's diminishing utility and the high costs of extending its lifespan, Musk proposes redirecting resources to private ventures and Mars exploration.

title: 'Reserve right to ...': Amidst trade talks, India eyes retaliatory duties against US
content: India has proposed retaliatory tariffs against the United States at the WTO in response to American safeguard measures on the automobile sector. The US imposed a 25% tariff increase on imports of passenger vehicles, light trucks, and specific automobile parts from India.

title: Big revelation on Op Sindoor: 'China fed Pak live data on India assets, Turkey sent trained staff'
content: Lieutenant General Rahul R Singh revealed that China provided Pakistan with real-time intelligence during India's 'Operation Sindoor.' He highlighted that Pakistan may target Indian population centers in future conflicts, emphasizing the need for a robust air defense system.

title: Samruddhi Expressway crash: Nagpur businessman Radheshyam Jaiswal among 4 dead
content: A tragic accident on the Samruddhi Expressway near Washim claimed the lives of four members of the Jaiswal family from Umred. The incident occurred when their car collided with a divider, resulting in the deaths of Radheshyam Jaiswal, Madhuri Jaiswal, Vaidehi Jaiswal, and Sangeeta Jaiswal. The driver is critically injured and under treatment.

title: Nvidia sets new record: Surpasses Apple & Microsoft
content: Nvidia's market value soared to $3.92 trillion on Thursday, potentially making it the most valuable company ever, driven by Wall Street's AI optimism. Surpassing Apple's previous record, Nvidia's specialized chips are crucial for training large AI models, fueling immense demand. Its market capitalization exceeds the combined value of all publicly listed companies in Canada, Mexico, and even the United Kingdom.

title: '6 balls, 6 actions': Ishan Kishan imitates Dhoni, Harbhajan, Warne in 1 over
content: Ishan Kishan last played a Test for India during the tour of the West Indies in July 2023. While his IPL 2025 season with Sunrisers Hyderabad was modest ‚Äî 354 runs in 14 games ‚Äî his recent red-ball form in England has been far more compelling. On Wednesday, in an unexpected turn, he was handed the ball and made full use of the opportunity.

title: Leave India...: Foxconn to Chinese staff at Indian iPhone factories; What's Beijing's role
content: Apple's iPhone production faces disruption as Foxconn experiences a significant withdrawal of Chinese engineers from its Indian facilities, impacting the ramp-up for iPhone 17 manufacturing. This exodus, influenced by China's efforts to restrict technology transfer and skilled labor exports, threatens Apple's ambitious goals to shift iPhone production to India amidst rising geopolitical tensions and supply chain diversification efforts.

title: 38 years of guilt: Kerala man, in his 50s, confesses to killing unknown man in 1986
content: In Kerala's Malappuram district, Muhammadali, 52, confessed to a killing he committed as a 14-year-old in 1986. He claims he acted in self-defense after being harassed while working on Devassya's property in Kozhikode. Burdened by guilt following recent family tragedies, Muhammadali led police to the scene.

title: Watch: Massive fireball erupts in Rome fuel depot; over 20 injured
content: A massive explosion at a Rome fuel station injured 20, including eight police officers responding to the scene. Initial reports suggest a truck crashed into a pipeline, triggering the blast and subsequent fires. The incident, marked by a large fireball and thick smoke, prompted evacuations of nearby buildings, including a children's camp.

title: Lauren Kyle Builds Own Legacy: Connor McDavid's wife makes mark in design and fashion
content: Lauren Kyle McDavid is emerging as a prominent figure in Edmonton's design and fashion scene, establishing her own identity beyond her husband's hockey fame. She launched Trove Living, a high-end furniture showroom and design firm, and founded Sports Club Atelier, a sportswear label. With McDavid's support, Kyle's entrepreneurial spirit is transforming Edmonton's creative landscape, marking her as a rising force.

title: Aaron Rodgers blasts ‚Äòsick society‚Äô: Plans private life after last season
content: Aaron Rodgers plans to disappear from the spotlight after his final NFL season with the Pittsburgh Steelers. He confirmed his one-year deal and desire to leave public life completely with his wife, Brittani. Rodgers defends Brittani's privacy and criticizes paparazzi intrusion. He won't sell wedding photos or leak family information.

title: Cardi B reacts sharply: Stefon Diggs‚Äô Europe trip stirs buzz, cryptic 3-word message
content: Stefon Diggs, the New England Patriots wide receiver, recently took a luxurious European vacation, sharing stylish photos on Instagram. His posts garnered attention, especially after Cardi B playfully commented on one picture. The rapper also revealed their stay in a lavish French castle, highlighting Diggs' grand romantic gesture and captivating fans with their glamorous lifestyle.

title: Dalai Lama successor: Tibet's prez-in-exile picks apart China's 'Golden Urn' tradition
content: The Central Tibetan Administration (CTA) president, Penpa Tsering, challenged China's claim over the Dalai Lama's succession, questioning Beijing's interference in Tibetan religious freedom. This response follows China's insistence on the 'Golden Urn' process, which Tsering argues is a relatively recent imposition.

title: DSP Siraj breathes fire! Sends Stokes for a duck, leaves Root fuming - WATCH
content: Mohammed Siraj's fiery spell on Day 3 of the Edgbaston Test has put India in a commanding position. He dismissed Joe Root and then Ben Stokes for a golden duck in consecutive deliveries. Root edged a flick to Pant, while Stokes was undone by a sharp bouncer. India aims to level the series after England's initial victory.

title: 'Is ECI God?': Pappu Yadav's 'do-or-die' call as Bihar roll revision row flares
content: Pappu Yadav, a Congress-leaning MP, has declared a "do-or-die battle" against the Election Commission's electoral roll revision in Bihar, labeling the ECI as an "office of the RSS." Congress has also criticized the revision as a "sinister exercise" to disenfranchise voters. Despite opposition protests, parties like RJD, Congress, and others have deployed thousands of BLAs for the revision process.

title: Vanessa Bryant steps out: Special mother-daughter night, honors Dodgers‚Äô Clayton Kershaw
content: Vanessa Bryant, continuing the family's Dodgers fandom, attended a game with her daughters Natalia, Bianka, and Capri. The family cheered on their favorite team as Clayton Kershaw achieved his 3,000th strikeout, a significant milestone. Vanessa shared photos and videos of the special night on Instagram, highlighting the family's love for baseball and celebrating Kershaw's achievement.

title: Krishna Janmabhoomi row: Allahabad HC says Shahi Eidgah ‚Äònot disputed‚Äô; plea dismissed
content: The Allahabad High Court has dismissed a plea by the Shahi Jama Masjid committee, challenging a survey of the Shahi Idgah mosque in Sambhal. Hindus claim the mosque was built over a demolished temple.

title: Caught on cam: Man sets relative's house on fire over financial dispute
content: In Bengaluru's Vivek Nagar, Subramani allegedly set fire to his relative Sathish Kumar's house over a financial dispute. The incident, occurring on July 1st, caused damage to the property, though no injuries were reported. The conflict stemmed from a loan taken years ago by Parvati from Venkataramani.

title: Reshad Jones loses $2.6M: Alleged con by trusted advisor; luxury spending spree
content: Former Miami Dolphins safety Reshad Jones, known for his on-field prowess, is now a victim of a $2.6 million embezzlement scheme. Financial advisor Isaiah Williams allegedly siphoned funds for personal luxuries, with Octavia Monique Graham accused of laundering over $1 million. Graham is in custody, while Williams remains at large, leaving Jones grappling with betrayal and significant financial loss.

title: Elon Musk wants the ISS retired: Slams Trump‚Äôs $1.25 billion funding
content: Elon Musk wants the International Space Station to shut down. He suggests focusing on Mars missions instead. He thinks the ISS is old and costly. NASA plans to deorbit the ISS by 2030. Some support Musk's Mars vision. Others worry about losing ISS research and partnerships. A gradual shift is a suggested solution. The debate continues.

title: Joe Burrow trends online: Fans spot him alone, 'extremely sad' in Beverly Hills
content: A video shows Joe Burrow walking alone in Beverly Hills. This has led to fan concern. The Bengals quarterback appeared downcast. Social media is full of reactions and theories. Some fans worry about his well-being. Others speculate about the reason for his mood. There is no official statement from Burrow or the Bengals. The internet continues to discuss the video.

title: Delhi double murder: Boy walked into scene of mother's murder, tried to hide in bathroom
content: In a shocking incident in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar, Mukesh Paswan, a garment worker, murdered his employer's wife and teenage son. The gruesome crime occurred after a dispute over a Rs 45,000 advance and Paswan's absenteeism. He was arrested in UP while attempting to flee.

title: CUET UG 2025 scorecards released at examinationservices.nic.in, check direct link here
content: The CUET UG 2025 result has been officially declared by the National Testing Agency. Over 13 lakh candidates can now check their scorecards on cuet.nta.nic.in or through the direct result link. The scores will be used for admissions across 243 universities, including DU, BHU, JNU, and AMU. This year‚Äôs results are based on normalised percentiles, and include postponed papers such as Tamil, Urdu, and accountancy. Counselling and admission processes will begin shortly.

title: Watch: Russian boxer gives e-cigarette to orangutan; video sparks outrage
content: Russian boxer Anastasia Luchkina is under fire after a video surfaced showing her giving an e-cigarette to Dana, an orangutan at a Crimean safari park. The endangered orangutan has since exhibited disturbing behavior, including loss of appetite and lethargy. Veterinarians are examining Dana, fearing she may have ingested the nicotine cartridge, while the incident has sparked widespread outrage and condemnation.

title: 'Drag India forward like Kohli': Vaughan's challenge to Gill, Jaiswal, Pant
content: Michael Vaughan believes Shubman Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Rishabh Pant must collectively fill the void left by Virat Kohli's departure from Test cricket. Vaughan acknowledged their potential but emphasised the need to replicate Kohli's intensity and global dominance to maintain India's competitive edge. He cautioned against underestimating the impact of losing Kohli and Rohit Sharma.

title: Himachal rain crisis: 69 dead, many missing; rescue ops on
content: Torrential rains and cloudbursts in Himachal Pradesh have claimed at least 69 lives and caused over Rs 400 crore in damages since June 20. Mandi district is the worst-hit, with homes collapsing and vehicles being swept away. Rescue operations are underway as the IMD forecasts continued heavy rainfall and potential landslides.

title: Trent share price today: Stock drops around 9%; Nuvama downgrades
content: Trent Ltd.'s shares plummeted 8.7% after its AGM revealed a projected revenue growth slowdown to 20% for Q1FY26, significantly lower than the previous 35% CAGR. Nuvama brokerage downgraded the stock to 'hold,' reducing the target price due to concerns about moderating growth and high valuations.

title: Aastha Poonia becomes 1st woman to be trained as fighter pilot
content: Slt Aastha Poonia made history as the first woman to be trained as a fighter pilot in the Indian Navy. She and Lt Atul Kumar Dhull were awarded the 'Wings of Gold' at @IN_Dega. This achievement marks a significant step towards gender inclusivity in Naval Aviation, promoting equality and opportunity within the Indian Navy.

title: Drunk teacher dances with schoolgirls in classroom; suspended after viral video
content: A shocking video surfaced from Pashupatipur Primary School in Wadrafnagar, showing headmaster Laxmi Narayan Singh intoxicated and dancing inappropriately with girl students. This misconduct, along with allegations of frequent inebriation and unwarranted physical punishment, prompted swift action. Balrampur District Education Officer D N Mishra suspended Singh, and local MLA Shakuntala Porte demanded strict disciplinary measures.

title: Tamil Nadu 2026 polls: TVK names actor Vijay CM candidate; can he take on MK Stalin?
content: Vijay, the Tamil film star, has been announced as the chief ministerial candidate for his party, Tamizhaga Vetri Kazhagam (TVK), in the 2026 Tamil Nadu assembly elections. TVK, launched in February 2024, aims to bring fundamental political change. Vijay plans a state-wide tour from September to December to strengthen the party's base.

title: Chess | 'No time for noise': Vidit Gujrathi hits out at 'LiverDoc' for insulting doctor parents, family
content: Grandmaster Vidit Gujrathi defended his family members' professions after a social media user questioned their legitimacy as doctors on National Doctors' Day. The dispute arose when Gujrathi acknowledged his father, an ayurvedic specialist, mother, a cosmetologist, sister, a physiotherapist, and wife, a homeopathic doctor.

title: ‚ÄòProud mom moment‚Äô: Hillary Trocheck reacts as Will Cuylle renews contract with NHL team
content: When rookie Will Cuylle faced living in a hotel, Vincent Trocheck, remembering his own challenging start, offered him a home with his family in Harrison, New York. Cuylle quickly became part of the Trocheck family, celebrated by Vincent's wife, Hillary, who proudly calls him her son. Recently, Cuylle signed a two-year, $7.

title: India to spend Rs 1L crore for spy planes, naval gear; China-Pak axis stirs urgency
content: Defence ministry has approved acquisition projects worth over Rs 1 lakh crore. The approvals include indigenous construction of mine countermeasure vessels, procurement of quick-reaction surface-to-air missile systems, and intelligence, surveillance, target acquisition & reconnaissance planes. Other projects include semi-submersible autonomous vessels, armored recovery vehicles, and electronic warfare systems to boost India's defense capabilities.

title: 'Till lion learns to write...': Radhika Gupta slams Prada amid sandals row; what she said
content: Prada faces online criticism for sandals resembling Indian Kolhapuri chappals without acknowledging the artisans. Edelweiss MF CEO Radhika Gupta emphasized the importance of crediting original creators and preserving India's textile heritage. Following backlash, Prada will meet with MACCIA on July 11 to discuss potential collaboration, including co-branded collections and skill development, aiming to recognize and benefit Kolhapuri artisans.

title: Bharat Mobility Expo‚Äôs next edition announced: And it‚Äôs not next year! Details
content: The Bharat Mobility Global Expo is gearing up for its 2027 edition. The event will take place in Delhi NCR. It is scheduled from February 4 to 9. The expo will showcase automotive, logistics, and technology advancements. New segments will include multimodal, urban, and rural mobility. Tractors and agricultural solutions will also be highlighted.

title: Language row: Maha minister asks why 'Javed, Aamir' spared for not speaking Marathi
content: Following the assault of a shopkeeper in Mira Road for not speaking Marathi, Maharashtra minister Nitesh Rane urged, "show courage, go to Null Bazaar, Mohammed Ali Road and tell people there to speak Marathi." The incident occurred after an argument over language, with the shopkeeper claiming he was slapped for stating that many languages are spoken in Maharashtra.

title: Jane Street ban: Why has SEBI barred US-based trading firm? Explained
content: India's SEBI has accused Jane Street of market manipulation, alleging the firm artificially inflated stock prices to benefit from options trading, generating substantial profits. The regulator has frozen Rs 4,844 crore and imposed a market ban on the global trading giant. Jane Street has the option to appeal the decision.

title: Secret wedding? New twist in honeymoon case; cops find second 'mangalsutra'
content: The brother of murdered Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi suspects Raja‚Äôs wife, Sonam, the prime suspect, may have secretly married her accomplice while in hiding after the honeymoon murder in Meghalaya. He criticized Sonam‚Äôs brother for expressing a desire to meet her after initially seeking forgiveness from the deceased's family.

title: Sources: M. Wagner rejoins Magic on 1-year deal
content: Free agent forward/center Moe Wagner has agreed to a one-year, $5 million deal to return to the Magic, sources told ESPN.

title: 'Devastated': Liverpool teammates grieve Jota
content: Diogo Jota's teammates at Liverpool including Virgil van Dijk and Jordan Henderson have been expressing their grief following the forward's death.

title: Osaka fades, out with loss to Pavlyuchenkova
content: Naomi Osaka will once again leave Wimbledon in the third round after a 3-6, 6-4, 6-4 loss to Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova.

title: Ex-Arsenal midfielder Partey charged with rape
content: Former Arsenal midfielder Thomas Partey has been charged with five counts of rape and one count of sexual assault by the Metropolitan Police Service.

title: 2 allegedly stole $2M+ from ex-Dolphins safety
content: A woman is in jail after she and a former financial adviser were accused of stealing millions of dollars from former Dolphins safety Reshad Jones.

title: Boxer Ch√°vez Jr. arrested by ICE, to be deported
content: The family of Mexican boxer Julio C√©sar Ch√°vez Jr. says it has "full confidence in his innocence" after he was arrested by U.S. immigration officers and set to be deported to Mexico.

title: Trump wants UFC fight on White House grounds
content: President Donald Trump says he is thinking of staging a UFC match on the White House grounds with upward of 20,000 spectators to celebrate 250 years of American independence.

title: Hammon slams Aces' 'trash' effort in 27-point loss
content: The Aces shot 26.2% and were routed 81-54 by the Fever, causing coach Becky Hammon to call it "one of the worst games I've ever seen."

title: üèà Who's the best No. 1 NFL draft pick ever?
content: We went through every NFL draft since 1967 and named the best selection at every slot, from Peyton Manning at No. 1 to Brock Purdy at No. 262.

content: Joey Chestnut is one of the most decorated competitive eaters of all time. Take a look at some of the notable records he holds in his career.

content: The three-time MVP's practical solution to keeping her legs balanced has taken hold across the sports world.

title: From New York to Michigan: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 2 quiz
content: You say you're a fan, but how well do you know your state sports trivia? Cue our second "state check" of the summer.

title: 'The great ones know how to find it': Why K.C. still expects the best from Travis Kelce
content: Chiefs coaches and teammates don't doubt Kelce's ability to step up in clutch moments again like he did in the playoffs last season.

title: How every five-star recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 21 five-stars in the Class of '26. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: USMNT still hasn't had a convincing win since Mauricio Pochettino took over. Time is running out
content: Since Pochettino became USMNT coach, the team still hasn't had a signature win. The Gold Cup final vs. Mexico is the last chance before the 2026 World Cup.

title: Diego Luna, USMNT's Gold Cup hero, is ready to take on Mexico in final
content: The Mexican-American playmaker is excited for his first encounter with El Tri in Sunday's Gold Cup final.

title: Remembering Diogo Jota, a star whose loss is felt beyond Liverpool
content: The death of Liverpool forward Diogo Jota has caused an outpouring of grief from those associated with the Reds and far beyond. As Jurgen Klopp put it, "there must be a bigger purpose, but I can't see it."

title: Jota's funeral to be held in Gondomar on July 5
content: The funeral of Liverpool forward Diogo Jota and his brother, Andr√© Silva, will take place on Saturday at 10 a.m local time in the Portuguese town of Gondomar.

title: Williams shuns Bar√ßa, signs 10-year Athletic deal
content: Nico Williams has signed a new contract with Athletic Club until 2035, snubbing Barcelona's advances to sign him from the Basque side this summer.

title: Chelsea: Grieving Neto to decide CWC availability
content: Chelsea coach Enzo Maresca said Pedro Neto is grieving the death of his close friend and Portugal teammate Diogo Jota, and the decision to play in Friday's Club World Cup quarterfinal against Palmeiras is his own.

title: Player demoted to U23s for 'unacceptable' video
content: Borussia M√∂nchengladbach's Florian Neuhaus has been fined and banished from the first team after being filmed while appearing to mock the club's sporting director.

title: CWC 'difficult' for Cancelo, Neves with Jota's death
content: Al Hilal coach Simone Inzaghi has admitted R√∫ben Neves and Jo√£o Cancelo have found it "difficult" to prepare for the FIFA Club World Cup quarterfinal against Fluminense following the death of their international teammate Diogo Jota.

content: Wimbledon is likely Djokovic's greatest opportunity to win a record 25th Grand Slam. Can he possibly do it?

content: Max Verstappen again refused to be drawn on ongoing speculation he might leave Red Bull for Mercedes in 2026.

content: Seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton is the most successful driver at the British GP with nine wins,

content: From Oleksandr Usyk, a women's trilogy fight and Manny Pacquiao's return, ESPN picks July's best fights.

title: How Enslaved Americans Responded To July 4 Declaration Of Declaration
content: The summer air in Rochester, New York, hung thick with heat and celebration. It was July 5, 1852, a day after cannons had fired, flags waved and towns across America had burst into patriotic jubilation

title: Dozens Hurt In Fuel Station Blast Heard Across Rome
content: A huge explosion at a petrol station in a Rome suburb injured nearly 30 people, two of them seriously, and rattled windows across the Italian capital.

title: Escaped Pet Lion Attacks Woman And Children On Pakistan Street
content: An escaped pet lion chased a woman and two children down a busy street in Pakistan's Lahore, police said, with dramatic footage showing the big cat leaping a wall before pouncing on them.

title: Man Who Raped Pune Techie Was Her Friend, She Herself Took Selfie: Police
content: A suspect detained in connection with the alleged rape of a Pune IT professional at her home was her friend and not a stranger who gained entry by posing as a courier delivery agent, police said on Friday, casting doubt on her version of the events.

title: Bihar's Electoral Roll Revision: Reform or Voter Exclusion Risk? Expert Flags Concerns
content: The upcoming assembly election in Bihar has prompted the Election Commission of India (ECI) to begin a special intensive revision (SIR) of electoral rolls, a large-scale verification of voters in sync with the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2003.

title: Czech Republic Hit By Major Power Outage
content: A major power outage that hit parts of the Czech Republic, briefly halting underground trains in the capital Prague, was probably the result of a technical outage, with no signs of a cyber or terrorist attack, authorities said.

title: Russia Brushes Off Talks, Launches Largest Assault On Ukraine
content: The Kremlin said that it sees no immediate diplomatic way out of the war in Ukraine, hours after launching its largest ever drone and missile barrage of the invasion.

title: Trade Regulator Asks UltraTech To Submit Financial Records Over Competition Norms' Breach
content: Fair trade regulator CCI has directed Aditya Birla firm UltraTech, which now owns south-based cement firm India Cements to submit financial documents after its Director General in its investigations found contravention of competition norms.

title: 4th Of July: Timeline Of Events That Followed The Birth Of America
content: The signing of the Declaration of Independence was the result of a month-long political process marked by debates, drafts, and key decisions over several days.¬†

title: Chinese Sales Of Foreign Phone Makers, Including Apple, Drop 9.7% In May
content: Sales of foreign-branded mobile phones in China, including those of Apple Inc, fell 9.7% year-on-year in May, according to data released by a government-affiliated research company.

title: "45 Is The New 60": CA Warns India's Middle Class Could Be Broke By Mid-40s
content: India's middle class could face a retirement crisis by the age of 45 owing to rising lifestyle expenses, limited income, longevity and insufficient long-term savings, Chartered Accountant and wealth advisor Kanan Bahl has said.

title: Watch: NASA Mission Captures First Close Look At Peanut-Shaped Asteroid
content: NASA has released the first-ever high-resolution image of the main-belt asteroid Donaldjohanson, highlighting its unique peanut shape.

title: Man Pushes Wife Of Running Train In Jharkhand. She Falls In Ditch, Survives
content: A 25-year-old man from Uttar Pradesh on Friday allegedly pushed his wife out of a running train in Jharkhand, a police officer said.

title: 108 Kg Marijuana, Smuggled In Inverter Cases, Recovered From Noida
content: The gang was smuggling the drugs from Odisha by hiding them inside empty inverter shells and transporting them via train.

title: "Don't See God In Us, See God In Justice": Supreme Court On Lawyer's Remark
content: Don't see God in us, the Supreme Court on Friday remarked after a counsel said they saw God in judges.

title: What Zerodha CEO Said As SEBI Bars Jane Street From Indian Markets
content: Zerodha co-founder and CEO Nithin Kamath on Friday praised the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) for taking strong action against US-based trading giant Jane Street, saying that India's robust regulatory framework does not allow

title: 6 Months After LA Wildfires, Recreational Vehicles Is One Way Victims Are Coping
content: Terry Kilgore lives alone in his Altadena neighborhood in California, sleeping in a recreational vehicle and surrounded by empty lots that were once the site of family homes.

title: China's Message To India After Kiren Rijiju Backs Dalai Lama On Succession Plans
content: China has asked India to act cautiously on Tibet-related issues, while objecting to Union Minister Kiren Rijiju's remarks that the incarnation of the Dalai Lama should follow his wishes.

title: Japan Urges Small Island Residents To Evacuate As 1,000 Quakes Hit Area
content: Japanese authorities urged the 89 residents of a small southern island to evacuate after a strong earthquake on Thursday, the latest of more than 1,000 recent jolts to hit the area.

title: "Test Cruise": Japan Plans 'World First' Deep-Sea Mineral Extraction
content: Japan will from January attempt to extract rare earth minerals from the ocean floor in the deepest trial of its kind, the director of a government innovation programme said Thursday.

title: 'I'm coming home, baby!': Diddy's courtroom victory cry

content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: NHL free agency tracker: Updated list of the summer signings
content: a slew of re-signings and the trade of Mitch Marner took several big names off the free agent big board . the 2025 draft included 224 prospects finding new homes, and the weekend included trades for Noah Dobson , Charlie Coyle and John Gibson .

title: NBA free agency: LeBron's next move, Denver's deals, more intel
content: the lakers are holding about $8 million with the remains of their midlevel exception . a small bidding war for the young backup forward among several teams, sources tell ESPN . the los Angeles lakers have a long list of free agency options . they'll dive into the latest saga with other news and notes from around the Association .

title: A new world in Big Apple baseball: Steve Cohen, Hal Steinbrenner and the battle for NYC supremacy
content: the Rays and blue Jays are closing in on the Yankees in the AL East race . the rivalry between the two franchises has reached a point that those who have lived the rivalries were skeptical they'd ever see . "the Mets have kind of turned the corner from being that little cousin or little brother or sister," says showalter . they have followed parallel paths so far this season .

title: 'I learned from it': Jason Pierre-Paul opens up about fireworks incident that cost him his fingers 10 years ago
content: ex-new york Giants defensive end Jason Pierre-Paul owns a fourth of July accident that cost him 212 fingers . he has no choice but to be reminded of it when putting on a dress shirt and reaching for a button . "there's nothing to be embarrassed about," he tells ESPN last week .

title: Arsenal end defender Tomiyasu's contract
content: Julien Laurens explains why he thinks Viktor Gy√∂keres could end up at Arsenal. (0:54) Arsenal  have announced that defender  Takehiro Tomiyasu 's contract at the club has expired. The Japan international leaves the club after an injury-hit four years in north London, where he made 84 appearances in all competitions. "Everyone at Arsenal Football Club would like to thank Tomi for his contribution to the club and we wish him and his family all the best for the future," the  club said in a statement. Tomiyasu's exit comes amid a significant turnover at Arsenal this summer that has already seen  Jorginho ,  Thomas Partey ,  Kieran Tierney ,  Nuno Tavares  and  Marquinhos  leave the club, with  Mart√≠n Zubimendi  set to join. ESPN reported  last month that the club are also in talks with  Brentford  over midfielder  Christian N√∏rgaard . Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta is on a mission to guide his side to their first trophy since lifting the FA Cup in 2020.

title: Jerry Rice gives Bucs WR Mike Evans blessing to break 1,000-yard record
content: hamstring injury came on the final play of the season . the six-time pro bowler missed three games last season with a knee injury . he now has his shot at sole possession of the record, and he gives him his blessing .

title: One trade all 30 teams should make this July
content: this year's deadline is going to be complicated . only eight teams are more than five games out of a wild card . it might make for a slow deadline if all those clubs remain in contention by the end of July .

title: Issue 21 lakh new pattadar passbooks in first phase from August, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu tells Revenue officials
content: The Chief Minister also directs officials to issue succession certificates in respect of inherited lands and complete regularisation of unobjectionable government lands by the end of 2025

title: Naidu seeks GST exemption for mango pulp, Central aid of ‚Çπ130 cr. for procuring Totapuri mangoes¬†
content: A recent slump in exports coupled with weak domestic demand has led to a crisis, leaving over 1.50 lakh metric tonnes of mango pulp unsold in Chittoor district, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu in a representation to Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, he also seeks a reduction of GST on fruit-based juices to 5% from 12%

title: Resorting to violence over Marathi unacceptable, you can't be obstinate about it: Devendra Fadnavis
content: "You can ask people to speak Marathi in Maharashtra, but you cannot be obstinate about Marathi," Mr. Fadnavis told reporters

title: Odisha BJP likely to get new president by July 8
content: The nominations will be accepted on July 7, while voting for the post of state president will be held on July 8, if required, said the statement issued by Balasore MP Pratap Chandra Sarangi, the party‚Äôs state election officer

title: Protests escalate at Kerala University as SFI attempts to block entry of interim V-C Ciza Thomas
content: Activists attempt to block her again as she attempted to leave campus. SFI workers, police personnel clash in the process. Higher Education Minister writes to Ciza to revoke suspension order against Registrar K.S. Anil Kumar

title: Panchayat says collapsed building lacked fitness certificate
content: Panchayat officials say several buildings within the Kottayam MCH are in a state of disrepair, with no maintenance conducted for several years. They claim hospital authorities respond with indifference whenever they raise their concerns.

title: Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan lays stone for ‚Çπ1,290-crore Jal Jeevan Mission works in Prakasam district
content: Once completed, the first phase of the scheme will supply drinking water for 30 years to over 10 lakh population spread over 578 villages of 18 mandals in seven Assembly constituencies, he says

title: Police begin probe as man confesses to his teenage crime after 39 years
content: Thiruvambady police begin probe into the incident following the surrender of the suspect at Vengara police station in Malappuram

title: Over 200 weapons, 30 IEDs recovered in Manipur hill districts
content: Joint teams from Manipur Police, Assam Rifles, Army, and Central Armed Police Forces conducted operations, resulting in the recovery of numerous weapons, ammunition, explosives, and other warlike stores

title: Freedom fighter‚Äôs family gets land rights after long dispute
content: The family of freedom fighter Chellasamy of Keezhkurichi in Tiruverumbur taluk found that another patta had been issued for the land that it had received in 2005 under a government scheme

title: Private bus operators in Vadakara go on token strike over poor road conditions
content: The dawn-to-dusk protest organised by a joint action committee of bus operators disrupted the regular bus services between Kozhikode and Kannur districts on Friday

title: I&PR Minister highlights welfare schemes launched by Andhra Pradesh government during his visit to Eluru district
content: Kolusu Parthasarathy approves six new road works in response to local requests and directs officials to resolve public issues promptly

title: Work on culverts to prevent flooding on GST Road in Pallavaram and Chromepet to begin soon
content: Sources in the Highways Department say tenders for the project have already been floated by the railways

title: New 19.20 MW solar power plant to come up at Panjapur
content: The civic body plans to install rooftop panels at the integrated bus terminus, market complex, TIDEL park and other upcoming projects in Panjapur to boost sustainable supply of green energy

title: Congress to distribute five lakh sanitary pad packets ahead of Bihar Assembly elections
content: Move draws sharp criticism from the BJP, which terms it ‚Äúanti-women‚Äù and an ‚Äúinsult‚Äù to female voters of the State

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: WRD begins annual exercise of removing hyacinth from Uyyakondan canal
content: Continuing sewage discharge has made a stretch of the 1,000-year-old 71-km canal in the city a breeding ground for weeds and water resources department has deployed earthmovers to clear the weeds

title: Congress, BJP aid corporate hospitals by vilifying Kerala‚Äôs public health sector: CPI(M)
content: Govindan says Opposition politicising building collapse at Kottayam MCH to paint a dismal picture of State-funded hospitals. He says since 2021, the second LDF government has increased public health spending to ‚Çπ1,600 crore

title: Bindu cremated, demand for justice grows louder
content: As per preliminary post-mortem report, she died from severe head injuries and internal bleeding. Relatives say she could have been saved had rescue operations been carried out sooner

title: T.N. CM Stalin releases ‚ÄòCoimbatore Master Plan 2041‚Äô
content: The document has been prepared by the Directorate of Town and Country Planning under the Housing and Urban Development Department, with inputs from over 40 departments and agencies.

title: Residents demand immediate repairs to impassable Thirunanriyur‚ÄìAlaveli Road in Mayiladuthurai
content: The stretch connects villages such as Thirunanriyur, Alaveli, and Semangalam and  heavy usage by farm vehicles, lorries, and heavy vehicles led to extensive damage to the road

title: Activists plead for relocation of 108 ambulance control room back to Karaikal GH
content: The control room was completely shifted last week to the office of the Director of Health in Nehru Nagar, which is 1 km away from the government hospital

title: Anert installs Kerala‚Äôs first decentralised solar-powered grid-interactive Battery Energy Storage System in Thiruvananthapuram
content: The system can power up to loads of 100 kW and has a battery bank of 150 KWh, enabling continuous operation of one-and-a-half hours on full load in the absence of solar power or supply from the grid.

title: Pune rape case: Pune cops detain man in rape case of techie in Kondhwa area
content: The incident had taken place at a housing society in Kondhwa area at around 7.30 p.m. on Wednesday, June 2.

title: KSRTC to scrap fare rounding after passenger complaints
content: Passengers had raised concerns after noticing inconsistencies between the printed ticket fare and the amount collected, particularly on premium services

title: KSTDC to open a new restaurant on Nandi Hills to cater to growing crowds
content: Based on the rate of growth between 2023 and January 2025, the number has been projected to go up to 23.35 lakh in the ongoing year

title: Police arrest five for attacking Bengal Minister Siddiqullah Chowdhury's convoy
content: A group of people, allegedly belonging to a section of the TMC, hurled stones at his vehicle, smashed the windscreen, injuring him.

title: ‚ÄòGood Morning‚Äô keeps children well-fed in Koyilandy schools
content: The project, under which schoolchildren in Koyilandy municipality are provided snacks during the 11 a.m. break, enters its third year

title: Madras High Court directs Chennai police to consider TVK‚Äôs plea for demonstration against custodial deaths
content: Justice P. Velmurugan says, the party should give adequate time for the police to consider its representation

title: Maharashtra sees 479 farmer suicides in March-April; Minister says aid hike not being considered
content: As per a government resolution (GR) of January 24, 2006, farmer suicides due to crop failure, inability to repay loan from nationalized and cooperative banks or licensed money lenders, burgeoning debt etc are considered eligible for financial aid.

title: A.P. Finance Minister calls for real-time GST data access to all departments
content: The Minister was addressing a virtual meeting of the Group of Ministers (GoM) formed by the Union government to review and simplify the Goods and Services Tax (GST) regime

title: Mass protest in Vijayawada against smart power meters and tariff hikes
content: The protesters accused the government of betraying public trust by imposing ‚Çπ15,485 crore worth of adjustment charges within a year of coming to power, despite promises to reduce electricity costs

title: BJP ignores its 11-year authoritarian rule but remembers Emergency: AICC president Kharge
content: Upcoming changes will throw up lots of political opportunities: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy tells Congress cadre

title: Priyank Kharge slams BJP MLC Ravikumar‚Äôs remarks against Chief Secretary as reflection of Manusmriti‚Äôs misogynistic ideology
content: Mr. Priyank also took aim at the RSS, challenging it to list just 10 contributions it has made toward nation-building, economic equity, or social unity.

title: National Herald case: ED case very strange, Sonia Gandhi argues in court
content: The ED has accused Sonia and Rahul Gandhi, late Congress leaders Motilal Vora and Oscar Fernandes aside from Suman Dubey, Sam Pitroda and a private company Young Indian of conspiracy and money laundering

title: Operation Sindoor was ‚Äòfinest example‚Äô of commitment to defend ‚ÄòSwaraj‚Äô: Amit Shah
content: Speaking after the unveiling of an equestrian statue of Maratha statesman and general Peshwa Bajirao I at the National Defence Academy (NDA) in Pune, the BJP leader also said whenever he is plagued by negative thoughts, he thinks of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and Bajirao.

title: How Bhojpuri people migrated to Trinidad in the 1800s
content: Known as Girmitiyas, the ancestors of present day Indo-Trinidadians, were taken to the former British colony as plantation workers.

title: Why are Andhra Pradesh and Telangana fighting over Banakacherla project?
content: Seeking to utilise ‚Äòsurplus‚Äô water flowing into the Bay of Bengal, Andhra Pradesh wishes to link Godavari and Krishna rivers via Banakacherla project and alleviate Rayalseema‚Äôs drought woes.

title: Devanahalli farmers‚Äô protest: CM Siddaramaiah seeks 10 days to clarify government‚Äôs stance on land acquisition
content: Since the final notification was issued in April 2025, the State government has sought time to resolve the legal issues around land acquisition.

title: Five Naga tribes to resume protest against Nagaland‚Äôs job reservation policy on July 9
content: Committee says 48-year-old quota framework outdated; seeks review to reflect present socio-economic realities

title: Supreme Court refuses plea to reconsider NEET-UG results, says lives and careers of students at stake
content: The petition referred to how the provisional answer key had three errors, specifically in questions 52, 136 (Code 47), and 140 (Code 45).

title: TVK will never align with BJP or DMK: Vijay
content: The party also announced that Mr. Vijay would be its chief ministerial candidate for the 2026 Assembly elections

title: TMC leader shot at in Bengal‚Äôs Cooch Behar, BJP MLA‚Äôs son held
content: BJP MLA from Cooch Behar (Uttar) Sukumar Roy‚Äôs son and his driver have been arrested in connection with the incident

title: Beyond Bengaluru: A new crop of English writers from border district of Belagavi are keen to make their presence felt
content: Belagavi has historically produced writers in multiple languages ‚Äî Kannada, Marathi, Sanskrit, Konkani, and more. The latest crop of writers are trying their hand at novels, poetry and other forms in English

title: DGCA warned Air India Express about delay on Airbus engine fix, forging records
content: In a statement, Air India Express told Reuters it acknowledged the error to DGCA and undertook "remedial action and preventive measures".
